snippet: A statement by President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt directed at Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, added to regional acrimony as Syrian forces shelled the battleground city of Aleppo.
abstract: Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi warns Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad that 'your time won’t be long,' as Syrian warplanes and artillery shell the battleground city of Aleppo and opposition groups report heavy fighting around the Euphrates River city of Deir el-Zour; warning adds to the acrimony in the region as the Syrian civil war continues to spill blood and pour out refugees.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad from Beirut; Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates; Scott Sayare from Cairo; and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: A statement by President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt directed at Syria’s president, Bashar al-Assad, added to regional acrimony as Syrian forces shelled the battleground city of Aleppo.

headline.seo: Morsi Warns Assad: ‘Your Time Won’t Be Long’
headline.main: Egyptian President Warns Assad That ‘Your Time Won’t Be Long’
headline.print_headline: Egyptian President Warns Assad That ‘Your Time Won’t Be Long’
